# Higher Order Singular Value Decomposition

Generalization of the usual SVD for tensors. Usual SVD proceeds via the following decomposition $A=USV^{T}$ or in tensor notation,
$$ 
A^{\alpha\beta} = U^{\alpha}_{\alpha'} V^{\beta}_{\beta'} S^{\alpha'\beta'} 
$$
where each of $U, V$ are the eigenvector matrices of the covariance matrices of the respective indices of $A$, given by the usual $C^{\beta_1\beta_2}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{d_{\alpha}}}A^{\alpha\beta_1}A_{\alpha}^{\beta_2}$ and $C^{\alpha_1\alpha_2}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{d_{\beta}}}A^{\alpha_1\beta}A^{\alpha_2}_{\beta}$
